channel.title: Does Fedora 10 have good wifi support?
channel.description:
I know Ubuntu 8.10 has GREAT wifi support but does Fedora 10 have great wifi support as well?
I'm thinking about getting Fedora 10 KDE for my laptop for when I go camping and I need to use wifi spots. And I am also thinking about putting it on my desktop if it is very friendly with Nividia Cards. (Nividia GeForce 6150SE)
Right now I'm using Sabayon Linux, and I was wondering if going to Fedora 10 would be better.

item.title: Does Fedora 10 have good wifi support?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

bjc22:

Ubuntu 8.04 with my driver doesn’t pick up long distance wifi, Ubuntu 8.10 does, so yes there is a difference…

Newer version == Better support

Just like Fedora 1 wouldn’t support something as well as Fedora 10.

But lawl is right, you can install the latest kernel and drivers on any distro.

Read full topic
item.source: Does Fedora 10 have good wifi support?

item.title: Does Fedora 10 have good wifi support?
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Ubuntu 8.04 with my driver doesn’t pick up long distance wifi, Ubuntu 8.10 does, so yes there is a difference…

chrisn2323:

debian or arch

Is that the wrong topic or are you just being random

EDIT:

Nevermind, Fedora says my driver is installed but it’s not working, ill just use Sabayon

item.title: Does Fedora 10 have good wifi support?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

the distro really doesnt make a difference on wifi support, cause you can install any drivers/wifi manager to any distro…

Read full topic
